## Exploring Relationships and Centralities in Healthcare Networks of People Who Use Drugs (PWUD)
Social Networks - Spring 2024 -  <a href="files/Sue-Ellen_Duffy_SN_Spring_2024.svg"
target="_blank">Poster</a>

Network exploration using synthetic electronic health records (EHR) of people who use drugs (PWUD) to map their healthcare journey. The average recovery journey for a PWUD lasts over ten years and involves 6 treatment episodes. This project will serve as an introduction to understanding patient-provider encounters of PWUD and serve as a template for future analysis.

## A Sentiment-Based Exploration of Glassdoor Reviews in US Companies with Unlimited PTO Policies
Text as Data - Fall 2023 - <a href="files/Sue-Ellen_Duffy_TAD_Fall_2023.svg"
target="_blank">Poster</a>

Sentiment-based text analysis comparing employees' written reviews with their star ratings, assessing overall alignment and satisfaction related to paid time off.


## Boston Crash Trends 2012-2022
Data Fundamentals - Spring 2023 - <a href="https://dacss.github.io/601_Spring_2023/posts/Sue-EllenDuffy_Final_Project.html" 
target="_blank">Exploratory Analysis</a>

Exploratory data analysis on car crash data in Boston from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation. It marks my first experience using R for data coding and analysis, focusing on straightforward exploratory analysis without relying on statistical inference.
